statement: Adults in contact with the police because of a suspected offence have any features of mental health problems responded to in a way that reduces the risk of anxiety, self-harm or aggression.
Adults in contact with the police because of a suspected offence who have suspected mental health problems are referred for a comprehensive mental health assessment.
Adults with mental health problems who are in contact with the criminal justice system have a care plan that is shared with relevant services.
Adults who have a mental health risk management plan and are transferring within the criminal justice system have their plan reviewed by the receiving service.
